The President’s decision to turn his back on the agreement that would have avoided this needless shutdown hurts millions of Americans while forcing them to foot the bill. That is why we must come together and work towards a bipartisan solution to fully fund our govt immediately.
On top of that, over 400,000 federal employees will be forced to work over the holidays without pay - including law enforcement officials, corrections officers, TSA workers and Coast Guard employees.

🚨 Food safety inspections will be significantly curtailed 
🚨 Small business loans will be halted
🚨US exports will be delayed
🚨 State and local law enforcement training programs will cease

As the President continues his attempts to push through funding for an ill-conceived border wall, let’s not forget about the 400,000 federal employees and he many essential services that will be impacted by a government shutdown:
I thank General Mattis for his decades of service and commitment to our country. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/us/politics/jim-mattis-defense-secretary-trump.html …

Gen. Mattis was a thoughtful and steadying leader in an otherwise chaotic and dysfunctional administration. His resignation is cause for great concern regarding the future of our nation’s security and the preservation of alliances critical to the wellbeing of the American people.

To prioritize the funding of a border wall over the millions of people who will be harmed by an avoidable government shutdown is a betrayal of the American people’s trust and the President’s fundamental responsibility to ensure the stability of our government.

We are now 12 hours away from the #TrumpShutdown.
